Nice to meet you, Iâ€™m Michael. You can call me Michael, Mike or Mikey.

Here is a brief history of me, what I do and why I could be your best friend.


I live and work in Leeds with my wife Emma, our two superstar kids, and our little dog Ralph. Iâ€™m a fan of football, craft beers, running (sometimes/never), grower of veg, retro game player, terrible jokes, serial cake testing, and listening to a lot of music and podcasts.

With over 15 years of experience being a curious designer in public and private sectors, agency and contracting roles for clients of all sizes, specialising in leading and facilitating design, designing clean interfaces, as well as plotting services and products from discovery to launch.

I do all of this by telling memorable stories to describe the work I am on - using strategy, research, visual design, and user-centered design approach to complex design problems.

I'm passionate about all of my work, giving my 100% in each project, totally committing to delivering a solution of a high standard.

What Iâ€™m known for

  • Helped instigate and designed the first Design System for Department for Work and Pensions, ensuring we provide a consistent output for the end-users whilst allowing teams to control the process but make situational decisions
  • Successfully help lead design and deliver a politically charged service go-live. Presented the service design to multiple stakeholders, whilst joining teams from multiple sites and disciplines to help deliver a challenging service
  • Established new ways of working within Sky Bet, implemented ways to improve working relationships to help develop industry-leading web apps
  • Led the design for two iOS apps that were featured by Apple
  • Advisor for a start-up Emble on design and product direction
  • Design director on Bobbin and Bumble

Also known for

Running a mentoring program called Lets Learn Things - supporting designers and developers for career guidance and progression. Often covering subjects such as taking on more responsibility, leading as an introvert, building trust within your team, giving and receiving feedback and finally designing!
